poem:
**Free Tickets**  

Among the crowded rooms—   
faces, papered skins,  
polished airs exchanged with ease.  
Yet one turns sideways,  
a slip between notes,  
a subtle tune of divergence.  
In the heart's hush,  
what costs—  
danced away secretly  
with eyes blue  
beneath bluer lights.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Not appropriate to take free tickets, says minister in veiled criticism of Reeves Accepting free concert tickets is “not appropriate”, the housing minister has said, in an apparent criticism of the chancellor, Rachel Reeves, who received tickets to watch Sabrina Carpenter. Matthew Pennycook, the MP for Greenwich and Woolwich, whose constituency includes the O2 Arena, said he had accepted “zero” free tickets. Asked about Reeves’s decision to accept tickets to see the Espresso pop star,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
